page.title: 04My Journey to School
page.content: I say goodbye to my gran and set off down the long gravel drive. I stop for a moment to look for the baby ducks and their mum on the pond. I walk slowly through the dew-laden grass. The dog next door comes running down his drive to greet me. The next person I meet is an old gardener who always says hello. The rest of the journey is on my own until I get to Clipped Hedge where I meet my friend, Kate. A beautiful cottage is next on the route. Coming round the corner, a terrific smell is lurking in wait for us - the abattoir. But a familiar sight is soon - the well kept Heath. We walk by the shops and three pubs. The post office is a must for most school children and we stop for a while. The shouts and laughter from the playground is a welcoming sound and we arrive and meet our friends.
